guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

author.bio: 12/08/2021 The administrators are no longer committed to free speech on this website, but they will continue to develop the software so that anyone who is interested in hosting a free speech website can do so. Rest in peace, Ruqqus. It was nice.

body:
I think a different spin on this idea would be great. I think you should be able to block both users and guilds (you can already do so to the former). Sometimes people use these features to try to completely get something out of their mind, so when you block them it should make it look like they're banned so you can't type in the URL to evade your own block. I also think you should make your own list of words for feature to block posts containing offensive words, and be able to hide posts and comments manually.

The idea is to make things fully curatable from within your own account, that way everyone's experience is much better, and people who get triggered by everything can't make their usual excuses for censoring offensive content.
body_html:
I think a different spin on this idea would be great. I think you should be able to block both users and guilds (you can already do so to the former). Sometimes people use these features to try to completely get something out of their mind, so when you block them it should make it look like they're banned so you can't type in the URL to evade your own block. I also think you should make your own list of words for feature to block posts containing offensive words, and be able to hide posts and comments manually.

The idea is to make things fully curatable from within your own account, that way everyone's experience is much better, and people who get triggered by everything can't make their usual excuses for censoring offensive content.
